Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dustin W Minster was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

First 90 days STRAIGHT TIME. Last 60 days with Huber.
Standard release conditions.
AMENDED 8/12/2015:  SENTENCE CREDIT FOR 42 DAYS GRANTED-TO BE APPLIED TO STRAIGHT PORTION.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Count 4 was dismissed outright.
Cases 14CF1188 and 14CT411 was dismissed and read into: 13CF1142 and 15CF597.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin W Minster in court, in custody, with attorney Paul David Langer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.   Counts 2 and 3 Dismissed and Read-in to: count 1.  Count 4 is dismissed by operation of law.  Attorney Langer to submit a letter within 24 hours with the days of credit to be applied.  $10,000 bail reinstated.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #1.  
150 days Jail, Huber allowed after 60 days with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - TBD).  

FINE:  $1494.00, $1100.00 to be applied from the cashbail posted by Robert Mehring, $394.00 to be applied from the cashbail posted by Erin Minster.   
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $50.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to New Berlin Police Department from the money posted by Erin Minster.  

DL REVOCATION:  24 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.
Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through

The remainder of the bond posted is to be returned to the posters.
dated August 1, 2015 from Erin Butzer
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture returned, for Robert Mehring: Return to Sender- No Such Street
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Bail Bond Fofeiture
Filed by Attorney Langer requesting an earlier Court date for plea and sentencing.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring reinstalled.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program
